job description:
HR Data Analyst

Southfield,Michigan,United Statesthyssenkrupp Materials NA Inc.

LocationSouthfieldPeriodPermanentContractFull TimeStatusLaufende RekrutierungJob IDUS_901369_MX-MAT-USA00139

Your responsibilitiesSummary of Position:This position is responsible for internal human resource data management for the US and Canada. This individual will be responsible for the accuracy and completeness of HR system records as well as supporting the HR operations team in projects related to process improvement. This position reports to the HR Operations Manager. Key Accountabilities:
  • Maintain organization, position, and job structure master data in HR system.
  • Audit and preparation of weekly time and attendance file for payroll.
  • Assist in maintenance of employee master data, time data, and auditing for accuracy.
  • Monthly and quarterly reporting, both internal and business HR KPIs
  • Document current data processes and assist in creating forms and structure to ensure compliance with wage and hour and data protection laws.
  • Collaborate with the leadership team to identify areas for process improvement.
  • Assist in identifying system requirements and testing new solutions.
  • Provide support to HR users.
  • Participate in special projects as needed.
  • Meets TKMNA Employee Attributes/Competencies
The above is intended to describe the general content of and requirement for the performance of this job. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements.

Your profileRequired Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality at all times.
  • Strong attention to detail, process orientation, and quality of work.
  • Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, orally and in writing.
  • Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with people at all levels within and outside the organization.
Minimum Requirements:
  • Bachelor's degree, preferably in Business or Human Resources
  • Solid experience working with Microsoft Excel and other reporting tools
  • Prior responsibility for managing employee data in HR and Time systems
  • Strong working knowledge of Federal and state wage and hour laws, and their application in a time and attendance system, especially in California
  • Demonstrated time management, organizational and customer service skills.
  • Interest in or exposure to compensation is a plus.
